title: How to Make Gluten Free Fortune Cookies

steps.headline: Make your fortunes ahead of time.
steps.description: Come up with something witty, or make it fit into an event or occasion.

steps.headline: Beat the egg on low speed until frothy.
Beat in the sugar, a small amount at a time, and continue beating the mixture until it is very light yellow and thick.
Blend in the water and a small amount of the egg mixture into the corn starch.
steps.description: Once blended, add in the remaining egg mixture.

steps.headline: Heat a heavy, well seasoned griddle, until 350 degrees Fahrenheit (or until drops of water bounce when dropped on the griddle).
steps.description: If your griddle doesn't have temperature control, keep the heat between low and medium.

steps.headline: Drop a heaping tablespoon of batter on the griddle and spread it with the back of a spoon to about 4 inches (10.2 cm) wide and ⁄8 inch (0.3 cm) thick.
steps.description: If it is slightly larger or smaller, that is OK.

steps.headline: Cook until the edges are slightly brown and cookies can be easily lifted from griddle with a spatula—about 5 to 8 minutes.
steps.description: If it still sticks, the bottoms need to cooked a little longer.

steps.headline: Turn and cook the other side, until light brown.
steps.description: Be careful to keep temperature even.

steps.headline: Place fortune paper on the cookie as soon as it is removed from the griddle.
Fold opposite edges together, forming a semicircle.
Crease crosswise at the center of the straight edge to form a flattened side, then bend the opposing corners together for the traditional shape.
Set in a small glass or muffin tin until cookie cools and holds its shape.

text: Make your fortunes ahead of time. Come up with something witty, or make it fit into an event or occasion. Beat the egg on low speed until frothy.  Beat in the sugar, a small amount at a time, and continue beating the mixture until it is very light yellow and thick.  Fold in the corn oil.  Blend in the water and a small amount of the egg mixture into the corn starch. Once blended, add in the remaining egg mixture. Heat a heavy, well seasoned griddle, until 350 degrees Fahrenheit (or until drops of water bounce when dropped on the griddle). If your griddle doesn't have temperature control, keep the heat between low and medium. Drop a heaping tablespoon of batter on the griddle and spread it with the back of a spoon to about 4 inches (10.2 cm) wide and ⁄8 inch (0.3 cm) thick. If it is slightly larger or smaller, that is OK. Cook until the edges are slightly brown and cookies can be easily lifted from griddle with a spatula—about 5 to 8 minutes. If it still sticks, the bottoms need to cooked a little longer. Turn and cook the other side, until light brown. Be careful to keep temperature even. Place fortune paper on the cookie as soon as it is removed from the griddle.  Fold opposite edges together, forming a semicircle.  Crease crosswise at the center of the straight edge to form a flattened side, then bend the opposing corners together for the traditional shape.  Set in a small glass or muffin tin until cookie cools and holds its shape.  Wipe griddle and stir batter. Repeat. Finished.
